item.title: Rain Drops
item.description: 1 Problem 2 Solution 3 Reference 1 Problem Problem 49, page 189 in Simmons (2016) Newton’s second law of motion [ F = ma = m \frac{dv}{dt} ] can be written in the form [ \begin{equation} F = \frac{d \left( mv \right)}{dt} \tag{1.1} \end{equation} ] in terms of the momentum (mv) of a particle of mass (m) and velocity (v), and remains valid even if (m) is not…
